words.prompt: About. Tell me about your day. About.
Better. I feel much better today. Better.
Bring. Please bring your book to class. Bring.
Carry. Can you help me carry these bags? Carry.
Clean. Keep your room clean. Clean.
Cut. Be careful when you cut the paper. Cut.
Done. Are you done with your homework? Done.
Draw. I like to draw pictures. Draw.
Drink. Remember to drink plenty of water. Drink.
Eight. There are eight legs on a spider. Eight.
Fall. Leaves fall from the trees in autumn. Fall.
Far. The store is not far from here. Far.
Full. My tummy is full after dinner. Full.
Got. I got a new book from the library. Got.
Grow. Plants need sun and water to grow. Grow.
Hold. Please hold my hand when we cross the street. Hold.
Hot. The soup is very hot. Hot.
Hurt. I fell down and hurt my knee. Hurt.
If. If it rains, we will stay inside. If.
Keep. Please keep the door closed. Keep.
Kind. It is important to be kind to others. Kind.
Laugh. His jokes always make me laugh. Laugh.
Light. Turn on the light so I can see. Light.
Long. That is a very long train. Long.
Much. Thank you very much. Much.
Myself. I can tie my shoes myself. Myself.
Never. I have never seen a purple cow. Never.
Only. There is only one cookie left. Only.
Own. I have my own bedroom. Own.
Pick. Please pick up your toys. Pick.
Seven. There are seven days in a week. Seven.
Shall. Shall we go for a walk? Shall.
Show. Can you show me how to do that? Show.
Six. A hexagon has six sides. Six.
Small. The mouse is very small. Small.
Start. Let's start the game. Start.
Ten. I have ten fingers. Ten.
Today. What is the date today? Today.
Together. We like to play together. Together.
Try. Always try your best. Try.
Warm. The blanket keeps me warm. Warm.
